generated_passage: One day, Tommy Brock, a fat and bristly creature, caused terror in the woods. He moved from his stick-house to a willow tree, scaring ducks and rats. Tommy wasn't nice; he ate wasp nests and frogs. Despite occasionally eating rabbit-pie, he was generally unfriendly. Old Mr. Bouncer forgot about his rabbit babies, who were just starting to open their eyes. Tommy complained about the scarcity of food and accused others of poaching. Mr. Bouncer laughed and invited Tommy in for cake and wine. Tommy Brock squeezed into the rabbit hole, grinning. Later, Mr. Bouncer found evidence of Tommy's presence and tracked him through the woods. Tommy had left a trail of mischief behind him.
